description: From weak +‎ -ly; compare Old English wāclīċ (“weak; ignoble; mean”), and Old Norse veikligr (“weakly; sick”); both ultimately  from Proto-Germanic *waikalīkaz (“weakly; weak”).

entries.meaning: Frail, sickly or of a delicate constitution; weak.

description: From Middle English weykly, equivalent to weak +‎ -ly. Compare Old High German weihlīcho (“weakly”), Middle English wocliche, wokli, wacliche (both from Proto-Germanic *waikalīkō).

adverbs.description: weakly (comparative more weakly, superlative most weakly)
